November 2020 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Hello November, the greatest month of autumn! Welcome to another edition of the Justia Insider! The craze of fall has dwindled, and the time for friends and family has come, a time to celebrate Thanksgiving and the Day of the Dead for the Justia family. Do not miss the chance to wow colleagues, family, and friends with delicious food, drinks, and awesome costumes. Enjoy this holiday month to the fullest, and take a moment to think about all that makes you feel thankful.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Codes Crosslinking: As you may know, Justia provides yearly historical versions of the U.S. Code for all the States. The codes are accessible for free, and visitors can read, research, and compare the laws passed by the U.S. Congress in previous years. Well, now it's much easier to compare the latest versions with just the click of a button.

Jury Instructions 2020 Version: Our team monitors key analytics in our portals to have essential insights regarding performance and improvement opportunities. We noticed that the California Civil & Criminal Jury Instructions pages are some of our portal's most popular pages. Last month, we updated the contents to be fresh and current for both our visitors and users.

Reviews Admin Tool: In light of the recent Justia Amplify Review Tool launch last month, our team streamlined a process in the last few weeks to produce reviews by adding an internal review landing page generator. It will definitely provide a better experience for our team while setting these up.

Reminders

Requesting Time Off for the Holiday Season [December and January]
It is already November, so that means the holiday season is already at our doorstep. As you

know, this is typically the time of year when many people want to take time off. If you are planning to request time off during December and/or January, it is important to submit your Time Off Request Form as soon as possible.

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

Day of the Dead
November 2nd

The Day of the Dead, also known as All Souls Day, is a two-day Mexican holiday when people visit the graves of deceased loved ones and set up altars with their favorite dishes, drinks, and photos. Celebrating The Day of the Dead has a long history in Mexican tradition as the ancient indigenous people of Mexico have practiced rituals celebrating ancestors' lives for around 3,000 years.

*This is a non-federal holiday. It is not officially recognized. For more information about paid holidays please visit Justikia.

Thanksgiving
November 26th and 27th

Thanksgiving is a federal holiday in the United States, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. It is based on the colonial Pilgrims' 1621 harvest meal with the Wampanoag people. Rich in legend and symbolism, the holiday has been used as a day to reflect on the positive things in life, spend time with family and friends, watch football, and eat traditional Thanksgiving meals such as turkey, bread stuffing, potatoes, cranberries, and pumpkin pie.

NEW INTERNS | NEW FULL TIME EMPLOYEES

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Arturo Jara

Marketing Team

I have 25+ years of experience as a copywriter, creative director, brand planner, and storyteller. I am passionate about advertising, creativity, short stories, poetry, and the digital world. I've worked for both local and international ad

agencies such as Noble/DMB&B, Grey Mexico, Conill Saatchi & Saatchi New York, Publicis Mexico, Grupo Editorial Expansion, Y&R, TBWA, DraftFCB Delta Group, BBDO Mexico, and Lerma Agency. I've also been recognized with advertising awards at different festivals such as Creative Circle in Mexico, New York Festival, The One Show, and Ojo de Iberoamérica. I am a huge NFL fan, and the Dallas Cowboys is my favorite team. I love almost all kinds of music, but Iron Maiden, Leonard Cohen, and heavy metal are my favorite ones. I enjoy running, drumming, and writing.

Grateful acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance."

– Eckhart Tolle

Justia Ghoulies Awards

Instead of our traditional Halloween Costume Contest/Raffle, Justia had its very first Ghoulie Awards! Thank you, everyone, for submitting your costume for consideration this year; it looks like Halloween and creativity seem to go hand in hand! Pumpkin Carving Contest

We want to thank everyone who participated in our Pumpkin Carving Contest on October 23rd. We received a total of 15 spooktacular photo entries and had a great time admiring your imaginative carvings. Congratulations to Donovan Coronado and Andrea Cervantes, enthusiastic pumpkin carvers, who put their creativity and skills to work by shaping their orange squashes into astounding creations.

TEAM ACTIVITY

What do you eat and drink during the holiday season?

Yes! The holiday season is here, and most of us will get swept up by feasts and parties. Food is definitely the cornerstone of the holiday season as it brings people together. Food is full of memories, traditions, and great flavors. Click here and share the dish or beverage you have a craving for. We will share your answers on Slack.

WELLNESS

Health & Wellness Hour

In October, Justia had its first "Health & Wellness Hour" session presented by the Health Management Resource Program under the Palo Alto Medical Foundation. The Health & Wellness Hour sessions are held via WebEx every Wednesday, starting at 3:00 P.M. Pacific. Each week a healthcare professional presents valuable pieces of advice for our wellbeing. Do not miss any of the interesting sessions with a new topic each week!

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Command Line Heroes

Available on Apple Podcasts, Google P., Stitcher, Spotify, RSS Feed

"Command Line Heroes is a podcast that I highly recommend. In the episodes, people address a wide variety of topics such as tech history, the first OS, how open-source code was born, and BASIC's inception, among other important technology milestones. Interestingly, it includes the original audio from a variety of highly recognized tech conferences. Saron Yitbarek's narrative with sound effects is exceptional and easy to follow. I personally believe it's a great way to learn about tech history."

- Cyndel Salas

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta & Jose Ramos
